Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw and label a land habitat, such as a forest, including at least three different kinds of living things like trees, squirrels, and ants, with detailed illustrations and correct labels.

The student can accurately draw and label a water habitat, such as a pond, including at least three different kinds of living things like fish, clams, and water plants, all clearly depicted and labeled.
The student can demonstrate a variety of plants and animals in each habitat to reveal clear differences in biodiversity.
The student can illustrate patterns of where different types of living things commonly live, showing a clear understanding of habitat-specific animals and plants and their interrelationships.
The student can identify and label each living thing in their drawing to show a comprehensive understanding of how they fit into the habitat, using appropriate scientific names or descriptors.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit minor details or labels (e.g., forgetting to label one small plant) but these are rare and do not detract from the overall accuracy.
The student may show a minor gap in identifying an unusual living thing's role in the habitat (e.g., not detailing a symbiotic relationship) but overall comprehension is strong.
